alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 08 at 2:14AM MDT until April 09 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong westerly winds on Saturday will combine with single digit minimum relative humidities, well above normal temperatures, and an unstable airmass to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions. Critical fire weather conditions will return on Sunday across much the area where several hours of single digit minimum relative humidities and windy conditions will persist. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...All Fire Weather Zones except the North Central Mountains Saturday afternoon and early evening and again Sunday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest increasing to 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 45 mph on Saturday. West to southwest increasing to 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 45 to 50 mph on Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Lowering to 5 to 8 percent Saturday and Sunday. Up to 8 to 12 consecutive hours of single digit minimum relative humidities forecast Saturday and Sunday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
